comments:
On a fresh Eclipse 3.1.2 install, if a project is created with a name using .jar at its end, such as Test.jar, then the Open Type action does not work on any class defined in this project.

As the included stack trace suggest, it seems the .jar name confuses the Java Project in the resolving of its classpath entries, interpreting the project itself as JAR archive.

I'm currently working on a project where .jar project name are imposed by the organisation and I feel there should not be limitations on project names (apart from platform limitations on file system names).

This bug occurs also on the 3.2RC1 release. I don't know if it needs to be reported there also, so I will not do it unless told to do so.

------------------------------------------------------------------
